quotes.speaker: Ben Carter
quotes.quote: So the chain of custody is broken, and no one admits it.

quotes.speaker: Emma Veritas
quotes.quote: Yes, that’s why I’ve asked for a clear record of what’s been received and when.

quotes.speaker: Ben Carter
quotes.quote: But until that exists, my case is basically unprovable.

quotes.speaker: Emma Veritas
quotes.quote: I understand, and I’ve pressed that it has to be formalised.

quotes.speaker: Ben Carter
quotes.quote: Pressed? It should already exist by law.

contradictions.issue: Chain of custody broken with no accountability; advocate admits record should exist by law but it doesn’t

timeline_hooks.link: Legal breach of evidence handling duties
